title: Manchester Airport Car Parking Expert Offers Advice On Flying While Pregnant
text:
A leading Manchester Airport Parking company has launched a campaign to make more people aware of things they need to do when flying while pregnant.
A lot of women worry if they should or should not fly when they are pregnant. According to many travel agents, a lot of women cancel their holidays when they find out they are pregnant, especially when flying to their destination. Ukairportcarparks.co.uk, an airport parking comparison site has launched tips on their site to give women who are pregnant.
The tips given on the UK Airport Car Parks blog ( http://www.ukairportcarparks.co.uk/blog/flying-while-pregnant ) help pregnant women understand what steps they need to take to be safer while flying abroad. The tips given include ways to avoid DVT, which is a serious problem for women who fly while pregnant.
The airport parking company who provide holidaymakers with an airport parking comparison tool that helps people find cheaper parking at airports around the UK, felt it was important to issue the tips.
Chris Fryer from UK Airport Car Parks said: “A lot of women worry about flying when they are pregnant. However, if they follow our tips and also speak to their doctor then they can feel safer while flying abroad.”
The tips are useful for people who are flying short distances from Manchester to Spain or for people looking to fly to Australia. The tips that include asking for extra legroom on the plane can be found at the travel expert’s blog http://www.ukairportcarparks.co.uk/blog/flying-while-pregnant
